item.title: i3pocus
item.description: i3pocus - Intelligent window focusing SYNOPSIS i3pocus [-v|-h] [DIRECTION] DESCRIPTION i3pocus is meant as a replacement for the default focusing function (i3-msg focus) in i3wm. i3pocus moves the focus differently depending on the layout the current window is places in AND the the layout of the receiving container AND the DIRECTION the focus is moved. If the focus is moved horizontally (left|right) into a horizontally split (splith) container, either the first (DIRECTION = right) or the last (DIRECTION = left) window will be focused.

item.title: budrun
item.description: rofibudrunpoly.gif In the gif above I use the oneliner rofi theme. budrun - Simple launcher menu SYNOPSIS budrun [-v|-h] DESCRIPTION When executed a rofi menu is displayed. The launchers to be displayed are defined and in the launcher variable. The first field of the line is supposed to be an icon, the second field is the name to display, the rest of the line is the command to be launched.

item.title: new_ass_features
item.description: I have made lots of small updates and additions to i3ass the last couple of weeks. The changes might seem small and subtle, but they have improved the experience a lot. I can now hide an active a container by running i3run on the active window, this is a much better way then using the move commands all the time. And floating windows now appear centered to the mouse position, but adjusted to the screenedges.

item.title: LL_011_polybar_hook_modules
item.description: www.youtube.com/watch?v=NZeqsLWcm6o This is part 1 of 2 in a tutorial on how polyabars “ipc/hook”- modules work. The goal of the tutorial is to create a module in polybar that displays the title of the active window, but if one clicks (or send a message via a keybinding or terminal) the title it will instead display the class and instance of the title. item.title: i3_flipping_tabs
item.description: I have gotten some requests on an isolated version of i3fyra’s tabswitching function. And this morning I sat down to try a new way to do it, and it worked .. pretty, pretty, pretty good :) Vanilla i3 doesn’t have a separate function for switching tabs, instead we use the normal focus [left|right]. This is not so well suited for tabs since if one focus right when the last tab is active, the focus will pop out to the container to the right if there is one.

item.title: i3flip
item.description: I extracted and improved the tabswitching function from i3fyra and it now works independently, i3flip - Tabswitching done right SYNOPSIS i3flip [-v|-h] [n|next|p|prev] DESCRIPTION i3flip switch containers without leaving the parent. Perfect for tabbed or stacked layout, but works on all layouts. If direction is next (or n) and the active container is the last, the first container will be activated. OPTIONS -v Show version and exit. -h Show help and exit.

item.title: pbmedia
item.description: pbmedia pbmedia - Short description SYNOPSIS pbmedia [-v|-h] [-c config-file] file … DESCRIPTION pbmedia frobnicates the bar library by tweaking internal symbol tables. By default it parses all baz segments and rearranges them in reverse order by time for the xyzzy(1) linker to find them. The symdef entry is then compressed using the WBG (Whiz-Bang-Gizmo) algorithm. All files are processed in the order specified. OPTIONS -v Show version and exit.

item.title: ass_divided
item.description: I have divided i3ass in two repositories, i3ass and i3add (i3 additions). My thought is that i3ass will be a more serious set of tools. While i3add will be more experimental and can be seen as a showcase of uses for i3ass. I do use all i3add scripts in my personal, daily workflow. i3ass function i3var Set or get a i3 variable i3fyra An advanced simple gridbased tiling layout i3run Run, Raise or hide windows i3list List attributes of i3wm i3get Return information about i3wm i3flip Tabswitching done right i3add function i3cast Create and upload screen recordings i3Kornhe Resize windows by moving the corners i3minimize Minimize active window i3monocle Maximize active window i3zen Send windows to the zenter i3term Launch a command in a new urxvt window i3wswp Switch workspace and wallpaper Installation i3add will have a installation script similar to the old install.

item.title: i3var
item.description: I found that marking windows is both clunky and it can have a negative impact on the workflow for users who use marks for other things. So i made i3var, it creates a ghostwindow on the scratchpad and use it to hold a variable. This can also be used for things that are not window related. I can for example keep track of my current wallpaper, but i have made some other crazy experiments with this and it works really well, much better then marks.

item.title: i3monocle
item.description: i3monocle - Maximize active window SYNOPSIS i3monocle [-v|-h] [-g] DESCRIPTION i3monocle Will first check the floating state of the active window. If it is floating, i3fyra -a (autolayot/toggle tiling) will get invoked to ensure the window is tiled and in a i3fyra container. Then all other visible i3fyra containers will get hidden. Leaving the active window in monocle (maximized) mode. If the window is already monocled, it will be put in ZenMode with i3zen if not the -g flag is passed.

DEPENDENCIES i3list

item.title: getkeys
item.description: getkeys - Clean xev output SYNOPSIS getkeys [-v|-h] DESCRIPTION getkeys executes xev and uses i3get to get the window id of the current window, to make that the target window for xev to listen for keypresses. item.title: i3wswp
item.description: i3wswp - Switch workspace and wallpaper SYNOPSIS i3wswp [-v|-h] WORKSPACE DESCRIPTION i3wswp takes a WORKSPACE number as an argument. If there exist a non empty ENVIRONMENT varialbe with the name I3WSWP_COMMAND_WORKSPACE . The content of that variable will be executed. i3wswp is intended to be used with some kind of subscriber script and be executed on workspace change. OPTIONS -v Show version and exit. -h Show help and exit.

item.title: subtit
item.description: subtit subtit - Output the currently open file in sublime. SYNOPSIS subtit [-v|-h|-l] DESCRIPTION subtit uses i3get to get the window title of Sublime Text. It extracts the filename from the title and prints it to stdout. If -l flag is passed subtit will follow symbolic links if any and print the source file. OPTIONS -v Show version and exit. -h Show help and exit. -l Follow symbolic links.

item.title: templatetator
item.description: templatetator - Create files based on templates SYNOPSIS templatetator [-v|-h] [TEMPLATE_FOLDER] DESCRIPTION script that invokes a rofi with a list of folders inside TEMPLATE_FOLDER. folder. It then runs the recipie file in the selected folder. It then prompts for a filename of the new file. The variables, CURFLD (the selected template folder) and CURFIL (the entered filename) can be used in the recepie file. OPTIONS -v Show version and exit.

item.title: subpro
item.description: subpro subpro - Switch sublime projects SYNOPSIS subpro [-v|-h] project-nane DESCRIPTION subpro closes the currently open project in Sublime Text and opens project-name in it’s place. OPTIONS -v Show version and exit. -h Show help and exit. FILES FLD_PRO Folder containing .sublime-project files defaults to: ~/tmp/kortisar/sublime/projects DEPENDENCIES SublimeText

item.title: budtutor
item.description: budtutor budtutor - Interactive tutorial for Sublime Text SYNOPSIS budtutor [OPTION] DESCRIPTION Interactive tutorial for sublime text. It is a mashup of vimtutor and sublime tutor. If executed without options, the whole budtutor will be opened in sublime text. OPTIONS -h Displays this info and exits -v Displays version and exits -s Shows ‘sublime’ exercises -m Shows ‘vim’ exercises -p Shows ‘packages’ exercises -c Compact view, only exercise and command

item.title: suba
item.description: This is a script I wrote to automate the process of uploading scripts and dotfiles to this web site. It analyzes the title of Sublime Text to get the filename of the currently open file. If the file is in ~/bin (my local scripfolder), it is a scriptfile, else it is a dotfile. Depending on the type it is sent to different directories within my hugo project folder. Which is on my Dropbox.

item.title: shoot
item.description: shoot - Screenshots made easy SYNOPSIS shoot [-v|-h] DESCRIPTION When shoot is launched it displays a rofi asking what kind of screenshot to take: Fullscreen or Select area. Then screenshot is taken and the image is opened with sxiv. When sxiv is closed a new menu asks for action: Save Upload budlabs. If Upload is chosen the user is prompted for a host (imgur, ptpb), finally a name is requested.

item.title: brws
item.description: brws - URL-launcher for terminals SYNOPSIS brws [-v|-h] DESCRIPTION url-launcher, does different thing depending on the url. Opens images with sxiv, and videos in mpv. OPTIONS -v Show version and exit. -h Show help and exit. DEPENDENCIES i3get sxiv mpv youtube-dl vivaldi

item.title: subpromen
item.description: subpromen - Switch Sublime projects with rofi SYNOPSIS subpromen [-v|-h] OPTIONS -v Show version and exit. -h Show help and exit. ENVIRONMENT SUBLIME_PROJECTS_FOLDER Folder containing *.sublime-project files. DEPENDENCIES rofi sublime subpro

item.title: getlink
item.description: getlink getlink - Puts a link in the clipboard SYNOPSIS getlink [-v|-h] [CATEGORY] DESCRIPTION When script is invoked without a CATEGORY a menu (rofi) is shown asking for category. A list of files from that category is shown in a menu. Selected file translates to a url that is put both in primary selection and clipboard. Available categories: budlabs (budrich.github.io links) github (github.budrich.com links) i3docs (i3 userguide links) links (www bookmarks) pix (uploads a image in ~/pix/r and return url) OPTIONS -v Show version and exit.

item.title: gethelp
item.description: gethelp - Short description SYNOPSIS gethelp [-v|-h] DESCRIPTION When launched without CATEGORY a list of categories is displayed in a rofi menu. When CATEGORY is known, a menu with pages from that CATEGORY is shown. Depending on the CATEGORY, the chosen page is opened in sublime or surf. OPTIONS -v Show version and exit. -h Show help and exit. DEPENDENCIES rofi i3run sublime surf

item.title: addlink
item.description: addlink addlink - Adds a URL to a file SYNOPSIS SCRIPTNAME [-v|-h] [-f figlet-font] [URL] DESCRIPTION addlink adds a URL to FLD_LNKS. If URL is not given selection and clipboard will be searched for URL. User can also modify the URL before adding it. An alias and category is required. OPTIONS -v Show version and exit. -h Show help and exit. -f figlet-font Figlet font to use FILES FIL_LNK File to store URL’s in, defualts to: ~/dox/not/links.

item.title: undraft
item.description: undraft - Undraft files on site SYNOPSIS undraft [-v|-h] DESCRIPTION Moves draft articles in the drafts folder to the location specified with the yaml key target. And un-draft the article(s). OPTIONS -v Show version and exit. -h Show help and exit.

item.title: postquote
item.description: postquote - Outputs a quote to html SYNOPSIS postquote [-v|-h] [[-f fortune-options] [-l MAX_LINES] [-w WRAP]] OUTPUT-FILE DESCRIPTION creates a html file with a quote from fortune inside a <div> block. OPTIONS -v Show version and exit. -h Show help and exit. -l MAX_LINES Max number of lines in the output. If the quote exceeds MAX_LINES a new random quote will be used. Defaults to 9. -w WRAP Maximum length of each line in output.

item.title: postbanner
item.description: postbanner - Creates a colorful ASCII banner in html SYNOPSIS postbanner [-v|-h] [-o output-file] [-l lolcat-options] [-t toilet-options] TEXT DESCRIPTION postbanner creates output-file containing a multicolored ASCII text banner inside a <div> block generated from the TEXT string. ‘_’ in string creates a linebreak in the banner. OPTIONS -v Show version and exit. -h Show help and exit. -o HTML_OUTPUT_FILE If not set output is send to stdout -l LOLCAT_OPTIONS lolcat options

item.title: blingking

item.title: i3zen
item.description: I made a post on /r/unixporn where you can view an animated gif of i3zen in action. i3zen - Send windows to the zenter SYNOPSIS i3zen [-v|-h] DESCRIPTION Put the active window in a tabbed container between two ghostswindows (centered) on a clean workspace. If the window already is in ZenMode, move it back to it’s original workspace. If the window is not in zen but another window is, both of them will be zen in a tabbed container.

item.title: i3term
item.description: I just made this script to keep my i3config cleaner. It probably needs tweaking if someone other then budRich uses it ;) i3term - Launch a command in a new urxvt window SYNOPSIS i3term [-v|-h] COMMAND DESCRIPTION Uses i3run to run or raise a window with the instancename: COMMAND. If no window is found, COMMAND is ran in a urxvt window with the same instance name as COMMAND. When the command exits window is cleared and returned to bash.

item.title: i3run
item.description: 18/01/03 - new position to mouse Floating windows now appears centered to the mouse position, but never outside the screen. Screen borders (gaps) can be fine tuned with environment variables. xdotool is a dependency now, it’s needed to get the position of the mousecursor. All windows are now hidden if targeted while they are active, if not the new -g option is set. Using i3var instead of marks. i3run - Run, Raise or hide windows in i3wm SYNOPSIS i3run -h|-v|-i|-c|-t [CRITERIA] [-g] [-e COMMAND]

item.title: i3gw
item.description: In the screenshot below, the windows to the right are tiled, and a ghostwindow is tiled on the left half of the screen. The other windows are floating. ss-i3gw1.png This might seems like a novel and unusable feature, but it is actually crucial for many of my script (i3fyra, i3var) to work. i3gw - A Ghost window wrapper for i3wm. SYNOPSIS i3gw [-v|-h] MARK DESCRIPTION i3-msg has an undocumented function: open, it creates empty containers, or as I call them: ghosts.

item.title: i3get
item.description: i3get - Return information about i3wm. SYNOPSIS i3get [-h|-v] [OPTION [CRITERIA]] [-r [tcidnmwafov]] [-y] DESCRIPTION Search for CRITERIA in the output of i3-msg -t get_tree, return desired information. If no arguments are passed. con_id of acitve window is returned. OPTIONS -v Show version and exit -h Show this help -a Currently active window (default) -c CLASS Search for windows with the given class -i INSTANCE Search for windows with the given instance

item.description: This is the power of the bash shell, you can write small functions to make using the shell easier. lb I found this one on the LinuxBBQ forums it adds the last command to a logfile. Example: adda dwn cd ~/Downloads this will add, alias dwn='~/Downloads' to ~/.bash/alias and reloads ~/.bashrc so you can use the alias immediately. apti/gemi/pipi install packages and log package name.

item.title: video_fyra
item.description: I have uploaded a long (~1 hour) video to youtube, where I show how to configure and use my layout script i3fyra. www.youtube.com/watch?v=t4Tve-xpwus Below are the things I added to the default i3 config file (~/.config/i3/config). # focus replacements bindsym $mod+Left exec --no-startup-id exec i3fyra -f l bindsym $mod+Down exec --no-startup-id exec i3fyra -f d bindsym $mod+Up exec --no-startup-id exec i3fyra -f u bindsym $mod+Right exec --no-startup-id exec i3fyra -f r # tabswitching bindsym $mod+Tab exec --no-startup-id exec i3fyra -t r bindsym $mod+Shift+Tab exec --no-startup-id exec i3fyra -t l # move replacements bindsym $mod+Shift+Left exec --no-startup-id exec i3fyra -m l bindsym $mod+Shift+Down exec --no-startup-id exec i3fyra -m d bindsym $mod+Shift+Up exec --no-startup-id exec i3fyra -m u bindsym $mod+Shift+Right exec --no-startup-id exec i3fyra -m r # floating toggle replacement bindsym $mod+Shift+space exec --no-startup-id i3fyra -a # window rules for_window [class="^.

item.title: the_site
item.description: This site is made using the static site generator Hugo and the text editor Sublime Text, using GNU/Linux as an IDE. I wanted a static site because cutting edge web development techniques and bloated IDE’s is not an environment I like. I have promised myself that the rendered site should only be HTML/CSS (except for google analytics and disqus). There is a lot of crazy stuff and bash scripting involved in creating the site, but that doesn’t affect the finished site or your RAM and bandwidth usage.

item.title: fresh_start
item.description: These are the steps I take to setup my work environment on a fresh install of Peppermint OS 8. Most of the steps are valid on other GNU/Linux distributions, but I don’t recommend anyone to blindly follow and install everything. Before doing anything else i start syncing Dropbox. I start with this step because it can take up to 45 minutes, so while Dropbox is syncing there is time to install and setup other programs.

item.title: mouseback
item.description: A while ago I got irritated how messy my i3 config file looked, and I researched alternative hotkey managers. I tried sxhkd and it is a fine piece of code. I got a much cleaner setup of the hotkeys and I could do stuff that i wasn’t able to do with i3. But a couple of days ago, i realized that my i3 config could be just as clean as sxhkd by using variables.

I explained it’s an old standard and agreed it was stupid, but that it would probably never change.

item.title: install_i3
item.description: You can probably install i3 directly from your distributions package manager.
